title: Machine Learning Modeling Project for Colorectal Cancer Metastasis Prediction

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational statistics, programming (Python), and machine learning concepts
context.additional_context: Collaborative learning using digital environments (laptops/cloud platforms). Utilizes simulated datasets mimicking real-world medical data

learning_goals: Within two weeks, learners can analyze missing data rates (≥20%) in medical datasets (e.g., patient diagnosis records), implement a Python-based preprocessing pipeline applying IQR-based outlier removal and age-group categorization (5 groups), and meet ≥90% data integrity verification standards.
Implement a Gradient Boosting model to predict colorectal cancer metastasis risk with over 75% accuracy.

Based on feature importance analysis (e.g., visit frequency, treatment response rates, biomarker levels), learners can derive ≥3 clinical implications (e.g., correlation between visits and metastasis risk, specific biomarkers and recurrence rates) and document them in a structured 500-character report.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
